headline: Apollo CEO Rowan on the need to rethink private and public assets
summary: Apollo Global Management (APO) Co-Founder and CEO Marc Rowan believes investors are overlooking how the asset management industry has evolved over the years. Rowan joins Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi at Yahoo Finance Invest, where he explains how the divide between "risky" private equity and "safe" public assets no longer applies in this market environment. Today, both private and public assets carry risks and rewards, with more companies opting to go private than public. While private equity continues to grow, Rowan says that “the biggest trend in our industry is investors, individual investors, and institutional investors looking at their fixed income bucket and saying to themselves, why is this 100% public?" To watch the full interview, click here. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. To watch live and see every interview from Yahoo Finance Invest, click here. This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Apollo CEO Marc Rowan: Elon Musk represents wholesale change, and the US needs it
summary: Apollo co-founder and CEO Marc Rowan weighs in on the incoming Trump administration.

raw.headline: Apollo CEO Marc Rowan: Elon Musk represents wholesale change, and the US needs it
raw.summary: Apollo co-founder and CEO Marc Rowan weighs in on the incoming Trump administration.

headline: Trump admin. is going to bring needed change: Apollo's Marc Rowan
summary: Apollo Global Management (APO) Co-Founder and CEO Marc Rowan sits down with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi for Yahoo Finance Invest, where he shares his optimism for the market under the incoming administration, the need for sweeping change, and Apollo’s small acquisition strategy. Rowan believes the US is primed for change, especially with President-elect Trump’s more business-friendly regulator approach. “We have stimulated our economy over the past four years, and we're about to get the dividend of that,” he said. With key investments in infrastructure and energy already in motion, Rowan sees the US in a position for greater global strength. “We're where the action is and now the question is, can we lead?” Touching on geopolitical risk, Rowan said that a strong power is needed to maintain economic security, and with figures like Elon Musk involved, he expects a greater push for transformational change in both the economy and markets. Looking ahead to 2025, Rowan stated that culture is key to Apollo’s success, noting that the firm is acquiring smaller companies to better complement its core business.Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management.To watch live and see every interview from Yahoo Finance Invest, click here.This post was written by Cindy Mizaku.

headline: Apollo Global price target raised to $163 from $155 at Deutsche Bank
summary: Deutsche Bank raised the firm’s price target on Apollo Global (APO) to $163 from $155 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares. Following the U.S. elections, the firm made several updates to its macro assumptions in its brokers, asset managers and exchanges models. Deutsche views the macro backdrop into at least 2025 as potentially fostering greater capital markets activity, with at least average positive equity market returns, supported by fiscal stimulus and potentially lighter regulation. headline: Cardinal Health announces two strategic additions to its portfolio
summary: Cardinal Health (NYSE: CAH) announced today that it has entered into definitive agreements to acquire two companies that accelerate Cardinal Health's strategic growth areas and that will enhance patient care. The company also provided confirmation of its capital deployment plans.
